intro: Hackelia eastwoodiae, commonly known as the Eastwood's honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
